body:
Earlier I was visiting this petshop called petco.

All of a sudden, when I'm visiting the back shelf of thepet store I see this.

Then, in my mind I start raging,
"I HATE ANIMAL ABUSE!"
"AHHH I'M GONNA RAGE, SCREW PETCO, THEY DON'T GIVE A CRAP ABOUT THEIR ANIMALS"
It's very sadistic, it makes us, animal lovers look bad.
I found out, that's what happens in the back of every pet store. 
Poor snake, he shall RIP.
Personally I prefer private breeders.
Now, compare that, with a picture of my happy snake.

I definetly would prefer that ^ Rather than dead snakes all over the floor.
Seriously, STOP ANIMAL ABUSE.
I know, earlier my gecko died of cancer.
Yes, he died. But I did not kill him, there was nothing I could do to save him. This however, can be prevented. If people actually started caring about animals.

#StopAnimalAbuse
Seriously, use that hashtag to spread the word.


"When someone abuses a dog, they are arrested for animal cruelty, when someone chops off a snakes head, they are seen as a hero." -26763

replies.body:
Y'know, its different for when its more harmless domestic animals like dogs or cats and etc.

But i dont mind abuse towards snakes because they're monsters. They can kill a human being at will. I don't even know why ppl would domesticate animals like these.

My older sister's boyfriend's friend owns a FRIGGIN LYNX! WTF! 

He pissed it off and it nearly broke his hand when it scratched him. Those things make wolves look like pussycats.

Morale of the story, don't adopted an animal with a history of frequent human kill counts: Snakes, Lions, Bears, etc.

replies.body:
I was saying that abuse to dogs and cats and other harmless pets is wrong. 

But animals like snakes, lynxes, and etc. Are... not right per say but they shouldve just been left in the wild like they should've been. 

Perhaps if animals were left to their environment and humans to ours, the notion o animal abuse would'nt have even existed. 

Think through the perspective of the animal, you were taken away from your family just to be a personal pet to a strange larger animal. 

What if humans were captured and used as pets or cattles by some other race. 

Im saying that this wouldn't have happened if humans just stuck to surviving by themselves. 

:/

Don't get me wrong, animal abuse is wrong. But i humans didn't adopt animals, perhaps society would''ve been different. 

I mean there are some people who love their pets more than their fellow man. Their species.

replies.body: If animals were truly left to survive on their own, where would dogs get their food? Where would cats get their food?
replies.body_tagged: If animals were truly left to survive on their own, where would dogs get their food? Where would cats get their food?

reply_to.body:
I was saying that abuse to dogs and cats and other harmless pets is wrong. 

But animals like snakes, lynxes, and etc. Are... not right per say but they shouldve just been left in the wild like they should've been. 

Perhaps if animals were left to their environment and humans to ours, the notion o animal abuse would'nt have even existed. 

Think through the perspective of the animal, you were taken away from your family just to be a personal pet to a strange larger animal. 

What if humans were captured and used as pets or cattles by some other race. 

Im saying that this wouldn't have happened if humans just stuck to surviving by themselves. 

:/

Don't get me wrong, animal abuse is wrong. But i humans didn't adopt animals, perhaps society would''ve been different. 

I mean there are some people who love their pets more than their fellow man. Their species.
reply_to.body_tagged:
I was saying that abuse to dogs and cats and other harmless pets is wrong. 

But animals like snakes, lynxes, and etc. Are... not right per say but they shouldve just been left in the wild like they should've been. 

Perhaps if animals were left to their environment and humans to ours, the notion o animal abuse would'nt have even existed. 

Think through the perspective of the animal, you were taken away from your family just to be a personal pet to a strange larger animal. 

What if humans were captured and used as pets or cattles by some other race. 

Im saying that this wouldn't have happened if humans just stuck to surviving by themselves. 

:/

Don't get me wrong, animal abuse is wrong. But i humans didn't adopt animals, perhaps society would''ve been different. 

I mean there are some people who love their pets more than their fellow man. Their species.

replies.body:
People need to start respecting animals, they are living things like us. They shouldn't be treated like this.

Some people say stuff like "stop abusing dogs and cats, but keep killing cows and chickens cuz I want the meat". That's fine, because as others have already said, you're using the meat, not killing it for fun. I'm not a vegetarian myself, but I'm trying to convert to vegetarian, and I limit the amount of meat I eat each day to a very small amount, a lot of times, none.

I really can't stand when kids torture tiny animals and insects. I hate when people step on snails, or pour salt on them or something. People bury ants and step on entire anthills. These things have a right to live as well, and I wish human beings would give them that right.

I really can't stand when kids torture tiny animals and insects. I hate when people step on snails, or pour salt on them or something. People bury ants and step on entire anthills. These things have a right to live as well, and I wish human beings would give them that right.

replies.body: PokerFace_Legend, there wouldn't be any dogs or cats if humans didn't mess with the animals. Dogs and cats are domesticated, and were bred. Also if eating cows/pigs/chickens etc... is right, then eating cats and dogs, is not any different. I don't think any of them make any sense to be eaten.
replies.body_tagged: PokerFace_Legend, there wouldn't be any dogs or cats if humans didn't mess with the animals. Dogs and cats are domesticated, and were bred. Also if eating cows/pigs/chickens etc... is right, then eating cats and dogs, is not any different. I don't think any of them make any sense to be eaten.

replies.body:
Actually, people used to do that, especially in Mexico and Asia.
Heck, when my dad was visiting India, he would eat anything, so he joked around about eating monkeys too. People do that too. Honestly, it's human nature to try and eat what you can, one way or the other. But dogs were more useful in hunting, so they stopped eating them. Cats are good for keeping out pets, so people stop eating them. Of course, some people didn't have cows or other animals as readily available or as cheaply available, so they went with other forms, such as dog, cats, and bugs.
We raise a bunch of chickens at home, and goats and a cow, and while i enjoy having them around as pets there's really no other way to get eggs or milk, and we shouldn't have to buy goat meat when it's easier just to raise our own. So while i do love them, I would kill them and eat them if it means eating another day.
EDIT: by home i mean my uncle's home, where my dad's grew up. OFC i live in the city now X3
replies.body_tagged:
Actually, people used to do that, especially in Mexico and Asia.
Heck, when my dad was visiting India, he would eat anything, so he joked around about eating monkeys too. People do that too. Honestly, it's human nature to try and eat what you can, one way or the other. But dogs were more useful in hunting, so they stopped eating them. Cats are good for keeping out pets, so people stop eating them. Of course, some people didn't have cows or other animals as readily available or as cheaply available, so they went with other forms, such as dog, cats, and bugs.
We raise a bunch of chickens at home, and goats and a cow, and while i enjoy having them around as pets there's really no other way to get eggs or milk, and we shouldn't have to buy goat meat when it's easier just to raise our own. So while i do love them, I would kill them and eat them if it means eating another day.
EDIT: by home i mean my uncle's home, where my dad's grew up. OFC i live in the city now X3

reply_to.body: If animals were truly left to survive on their own, where would dogs get their food? Where would cats get their food?
reply_to.body_tagged: If animals were truly left to survive on their own, where would dogs get their food? Where would cats get their food?

replies.body:
I put ..... because that was a very simple and not thought out question. 

Before dogs were dogs, they were wolves, foxes, etc. The Canines.

And before cats were cats, they were lynxes, lions, leopards, cheetahs, etc. The Felines.

It was through human intervention that these animals "evolved" into weaker and more passive evolutions because they didn't need to work so hard anymore.

If they were to be released back into the wild, they would be doing as their ancestors have been doing for thousands of years. 

Please think before you post your question.
replies.body_tagged:
I put ..... because that was a very simple and not thought out question. 

Before dogs were dogs, they were wolves, foxes, etc. The Canines.

And before cats were cats, they were lynxes, lions, leopards, cheetahs, etc. The Felines.

It was through human intervention that these animals "evolved" into weaker and more passive evolutions because they didn't need to work so hard anymore.

If they were to be released back into the wild, they would be doing as their ancestors have been doing for thousands of years. 

Please think before you post your question.

replies.body:
Cows, pigs, chickens are bred and slaughtered because of their meat quality (I think so, anyways.) 
It is human nature to eat meat, because that's how we are, although we can live a mostly vegetarian life, and living vegetarian would mean less starvation because you need to raise the animal that eats 10 times more plants than the food if produces. 
And in the American/Canadian area, more than 50% of our cows in stuff live in really bad areas.
